article: Miss Carter is a beautiful girl. Her father  _  two years ago and her mother made a terrible mistake and was sent away. They began to live a  _  life. When she  _  middle school, she couldn't go on studying. Her uncle found a  _  for her. Mr. Baker, a rich shopkeeper, hired her. Her work was to clean the rooms and sweep the floors. She tried her  _  and worked hard. Mrs. Baker liked her and paid her  _  than the other servants . It was Sunday. Mr. Baker was reading and Mrs. Baker was watching TV in the sitting room. The girl came in and said, "I'm  _  , Mrs. Baker. I have to tell you I can't work for you any longer." It  surprised  Mr. and Mrs. Baker. The woman asked, "What makes you say that? Aren't we  _  to you?" "Yes, you are, Madam," the girl said. "Have you found a piece of  _  work yet?" Mrs. Baker asked. "No, I haven't," Miss Carter said. "  _  I don't think you trust me." "You are  _  , Miss Carter," said Mr. Baker. "I always think you are a  _  girl. And I often leave my keys in my study." "It was  _  that you often left the keys in your study," said the girl. "But I could use none of them to  _  the safe ." "Well," said Mr. Baker. "You can go right now!"
